summary: Pancreatoblastoma is a rare type of pancreatic cancer that mainly occurs in childhood and has a relatively good prognosis. It is a tumor that can be quite large and is characterized by the presence of squamoid nests and at least two cell types: cells with acinar differentiation and cells forming small squamoid nests.
diagnosis: Histopathology showing acinar, ductal or neuroendocrine differentiation
